Roy T. Fielding schrieb:
> ...
> REPORT, on the other hand, is just plain evil.  It is bad architecture,
> violates REST, avoids giving a URI to important resources, and tunnels
> arbitrary methods through HTTP.

Sorry?

REPORT be definition isn't as bad as POST, being a safe method. Thus, it 
can *not* tunnel arbitrary methods, at least as long as the people using 
it read the method definition 
(<http://greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/rfc3253.html#rfc.section.3.6>).

Best regards, Julian
